text: my programming hero actually is probably
here tonight it's Ethan Marcotte he kind
of turned me on to both responsive
design and mobile first development
which have kind of been the staples that
I've built most of my career off of
don't sweat the details so much focus
more on understanding the rationale
behind why something is broken instead
of trying to make something pixel
perfect or trying to figure out like one
weird technology to solve a niche
problem kind of give up on something
that's broken and move on honestly just
like the web standards consortium in
general the ability to have these new
technologies that are coming out
constantly that I don't have to sweat
the details of it there's not some
company controlling it it's people like
me building something for me so that
we'll all have a nice better life at the
end of it so stuff like flexbox the
whole floating general web standards i
would say have been the biggest impact
the most exciting thing in software for
me would probably have to be
pre-processing not necessarily the fact
that we can pre process that's been
around for a while but the ability to
utilize it in a way that more people can
have access to it that makes your
websites faster in general or more
thought out and allows you to focus more
on the interesting rationale behind
making a website rather than getting
tripped up in the details probably
sleeping at this point but no I can't
think of anything else I I used to be a
graphic designer actually and I grew up
building websites or not websites I grew
up building computers in my friend's
basement and that kind of got me turned

like computer science field and so I
